abstract.text: This article describes the KeyboardKit localization engine.

inlineContent.text: A flexible localization engine is an important part of a keyboard, where every supported locale should be able to localize the keyboard and its texts, layouts, secondary callout actions, etc.
locales define localized strings, assets, and additional information. The native
is also extendewd with additional capabilities.
unlocks localized services for all locales in your license. Information about Pro features can be found further down.
and uses it as a namespace for locale-related types and views, like the locale-specific
The full list of supported locale names is:

English (en), Albanian (sq), Arabic (ar), Armenian (hy), Azerbaijani (az), Belarusian (be), Bengali (bn), Bulgarian (bg), Catalan (ca), Cherokee (chr), Chuvash (cv), Croatian (hr), Czech (cs), Danish (da), Dutch (nl), Dutch (Belgium) (nl_BE), English (Australia) (en_AU), English (Canada) (en_CA), English (United Kingdom) (en_GB), English (United States) (en_US), Estonian (et), Faroese (fo), Filipino (fil), Finnish (fi), French (fr), French (Canada) (fr_CA), French (Belgium) (fr_BE), French (Switzerland) (fr_CH), Georgian (ka), German (de), German (Austria) (de_AT), German (Switzerland) (de_CH), Greek (el), Hawaiian (haw), Hebrew (Israel) (he_IL), Hungarian (hu), Icelandic (is), Inari Sami (smn), Indonesian (id), Irish (Ireland) (ga_IE), Italian (it), Kazakh (kk), Kurdish, Sorani (ckb), Kurdish, Sorani (Iraq) (ckb_IQ), Kurdish, Sorani (PC) (ckb_PC), Latvian (lv), Lithuanian (lt), Macedonian (mk), Malay (ms), Maltese (mt), Mongolian (mn), North Sámi (se), Norwegian Bokmål (nb), Norwegian Nynorsk (nn), Persian (fa), Polish (pl), Portuguese (Portugal) (pt_PT), Portuguese (Brazil) (pt_BR), Romanian (ro), Russian (ru), Serbian (sr), Serbian (Latin) (sr-Latn), Shughni Tajik (tg), Slovak (sk), Slovenian (sl), Spanish (es), Spanish (Latin America) (es_419), Spanish (Mexico) (es_MX), Swedish (sv), Swahili (sw), Turkish (tr), Ukrainian (uk), Uzbek (uz), Vietnamese (vi), Welsh (cy)
with localized strings that can be translated with
, as well as collection modifiers, locale-specific properties like
information, search & sorting capabilities, and much more.

for every locale, with no additional code needed.
You can customize any localized service, as described in the
articles. You can also read more in the How to:s below.

described above, and the spacebar, will use the
by default, and will also set a keyboard layout type when the user selects an
You can also use the other
functions to select locales and layout types in various ways. Just make sure to only set a layout type that is supported by the selected locale.
, which controls things like spell checking and text direction. This also sets the keyboard’s language subtitle in the keyboard switcher.
, even after it has been set properly (and works). This can be a bit confusing, but just check that the proper language is displayed in the system keyboard switcher.
locale has a localized file in
with texts that are applied with the
To translate the same text for a certain
to set which locale to use when displaying locales. It’s set to the current locale by default, but you can change it to any locale, or set it to nil to use each locale’s own language.
KeyboardKit supports LTR (Left-To-Right) & RTL (Right-To-Left) locales. Just change the locale as shown above, and KeyboardKit will automatically adjust the text direction, spell checking, etc.
If you want to use a single, fixed RTL locale, you can adjust the keyboard extension’s
to the language code of your locale, e.g.
Just be aware that setting the primary language like this may affect external keyboard mappings if you don’t set the primary language.
If you need a locale that KeyboardKit doesn’t support yet, like Japanese or Simplified Chinese, you can implement a custom
configuration to support it, or reach out to add support for a new
localization folder. You may also have to implement custom autocomplete logic.

If you have expertise on a certain locale that you want KeyboardKit to support, you can reach out to help adding it to KeyboardKit Pro. If a locale gets added as a result of your contribution, you will get a free Basic license or a discount on the higher plans.
